divs: sighting detailsi was delivering pizza at the time, driving north on hogan toward wood village, and was approaching glisan\cherry park rd. to the north-northwest i spotted a dark object just above the houses and trees. i don't recall how it caught my attention at first. usually my eyes are rather focused on the road while on deliveries. my first thought was that it was a large bird hovering over prey, so i continued to watch. it then tilted slightly, glimmering and reflecting light as though made of chrome or silver. this isn't far from an airport, so i thought perhaps this was an airplane or helicopter, however i'd never seen one this shape nor one reflect light the way this appeared to. and they're usually moving at a brisk pace. this didn't appear to be moving so much as quivering and slowly rising, and was not growing larger as a plane would if approaching. my next thought was that someone lost a large, reflective helium balloon or was flying a remote-controlled toy aircraft. but the shape was odd, like a sideways fedora. at this point, i felt as though i was reaching for explanations for what i was seeing, and had a difficult time believing this could be an alien craft as it was mid-afternoon over a very public area. i continued to watch as best i could without risking an auto accident. by the time it occurred to me to grab my cell phone and attempt to snap a shot or video of it, it had begun moving (much more quickly than the aircraft i typically see in the air around here) to the southwest and was out of sight by the time i had approached the down slope north of cherry park rd and could no longer track it. even had i thought sooner to take a shot, i doubt it would've shown up on my low-quality cell cam. the entire event couldn't have lasted more than 20-30 minutes.
Summary: A small metallic object hovered over Eastern Portland, then flew away
trends: There have been no other sightings in Wood Village
This sighting has never been favorited.
